newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK money rates mixed, govt paper yields down.
newsitem.headline: HK money rates mixed, govt paper yields down.

text.p: Interbank rates were mixed in very quiet trading on Monday ahead of today's U.S. market holiday, dealers said. Overnight cash rose to 4-7/8 3/4 percent from 4-5/8 9/16 percent and three-month money was a touch lower at 5-7/16 5/16 against 5-1/2 7/16 percent.
"Market sentiment is a bit cautious on fears that U.S. officials may come up with some remarks about interest rates at the FOMC meeting in February," a Japanese dealer said.
But the market generally believed the FOMC (Federal Open Market Committee), the Federal Reserve's policy arm, would leave monetary policy unchanged at its next meeting, dealers said.
Some Japanese banks have asked for one- to three-month money to prepare for Chinese New Year holidays starting in early February but lenders were few, one dealer said.
Trading in Exchange Fund bills and notes was thin as U.S. Treasuries failed to provide any direction on Friday.
One week Exchange Fund bill yields eased to 4.38 percent from 4.47 percent.
Yields on the three-year note fell to 6.19 percent from 6.21 on Friday, while five-year note yields were 6.65 percent versus 6.70 percent and seven-year at 6.88 versus 6.94 percent.
